subject: Philosophy
title: The Repugnant Conclusion
description: A 60-second lesson on The Repugnant Conclusion.

hook.text: Would a world of ten billion barely happy people be better than one billion very happy people?

buildup.text: Derek Parfit showed that total utilitarianism leads to this: more people at a lower quality wins.

discovery.text: As long as each life is barely worth living, adding more lives increases total happiness.

twist.text: Parfit called this 'the repugnant conclusion' because it offends our deepest intuitions about quality.

climax.text: No philosopher has fully solved it. It haunts population ethics, climate policy, and future planning.

punchline.text: More happiness or better happiness? You can't have both.

quiz.question: What is Parfit's 'repugnant conclusion'?
options: A huge population barely worth living beats a small happy one
